Uses of Class
com.here.android.mpa.urbanmobility.AbstractRequest

  • Packages that use AbstractRequest 
    Package Description
    com.here.android.mpa.urbanmobility
    The package urbanmobility provides classes, callbacks, and enumerations that can be used to enable functionality related to public transit such as search for nearby transit stations and requests for departure boards.

    • Uses of AbstractRequest in com.here.android.mpa.urbanmobility

      Subclasses of AbstractRequest in com.here.android.mpa.urbanmobility 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AbstractListRequest<T>
      Represents an abstract request that expects List as a result, and provides access to common request parameters.
      class  CityCoverageRequest
      Represents a request to retrieve public transit data coverage by city.
      class  CitySearchRequest
      Represents a request to search city by name and get public transit data coverage for it.
      class  DepartureBoardRequest
      Represents a request to retrieve a station next departures board.
      class  MultiBoardRequest
      Represents a request to retrieve a multi station departures board.
      class  NearbyCoverageRequest
      Represents a request to retrieve nearby public transit data coverage.
      class  StationSearchRequest
      Represents a request to search stations within certain radius by name, geo-coordinates or IDs.
      Methods in com.here.android.mpa.urbanmobility that return AbstractRequest 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AbstractRequest<T> AbstractRequest.setClient(java.lang.String client)
      Sets the name of the client.
      AbstractRequest<T> AbstractRequest.setLanguage(java.lang.String languageCode)
      Deprecated. 
      This method is deprecated since release 3.2.
      AbstractRequest<T> AbstractListRequest.setMaximumResults(int maxResults)
      Sets the maximum number of results to be returned in the response.
      AbstractRequest<T> AbstractRequest.setTransitTypes(java.util.List<TransitType> transitTypes)
      Deprecated. 
      This method is deprecated since release 3.2. Please use AbstractRequest.setTransportTypes(List) instead.
      AbstractRequest<T> AbstractRequest.setTransportTypes(java.util.List<TransportType> transportTypes)
      Sets which transport types are allowed to be included in the response.
